TopicTitle: (0.23) Wayland Corp. Development and released download Thread (new parts)

Articles.Content:
Just watch the potholes on Duna....

Actually it sort of looks like you're pothole was inside out, it looks like it's up instead of down.
Must try new wheels!

Those do look pretty awesome. But there's one thing I want to know.

Do they actually rotate?

Those do look pretty awesome. But there's one thing I want to know.

Do they actually rotate?

Well, they wouldn't be much good if they didn't

see what happens to jeb at the very end of the clip lol

Edited June 8, 2013 by Devo
Hahah love the ending.

Ouch... poor Jeb... good thing the KSP has a good stock of clones!

I kinda wish the Dev's would add a counter, so you could see how many times you've killed Jeb... or would that be morbid and weird?
Jeb is dead. he hung himself with a bumper. (p.s HOW THE HEK DO DAT WORK besides for the fact his helmet got stuck between the bumper and the rover)
Yep, he survives all matter of risky space flight only to choke on a bumper.

haha yeah total accident, has not actually happened before.. and getting that thing to Duna is not fun!!! I built a 5m wide cargo bay with a 2.5 meter top and bottom attachment so it can be transported easily, cargo bay Well, they will be ready along with the other 9 wheels for the 10 wheel pack soon it's pretty addictive making car parts for some strange reason lol...

Edited June 8, 2013 by Devo
We call those people "Motorheads" in the States.

We call those people "Motorheads" in the States.

"Revheads" here

haha yeah total accident, has not actually happened before.. and getting that thing to Duna is not fun!!! I built a 5m wide cargo bay with a 2.5 meter top and bottom attachment so it can be transported easily, cargo bay Well, they will be ready along with the other 9 wheels for the 10 wheel pack soon it's pretty addictive making car parts for some strange reason lol...

For the cargo bay, you talkin bout that giant thing I tested a really long time ago?

Awesome!

Sounds like KSP is about to have enough wheels soon.

For the cargo bay, you talkin bout that giant thing I tested a really long time ago?

No, this is a stock part I am making literally as I type this.

It's a cargo bay, 2.5 meters at each end that tapers out to 5 metres in diameter, with a flat base and two fold out bay doors that go up, for easy access. Just sort the animation, ill post the part soon, its going int he Rover update pack with the monster wheels.
How about the 2001 vehicles? Those would be awesome

How about the 2001 vehicles? Those would be awesome

We are starting work on a gravity plugin for stations, and the first and to be honest, only station I'm doing from TV/movies is The Odyssey from 2001. That will be the test model for the gravity, basically when you can walk around the hub inside, I'll be happy and we can apply that to other parts.
That sounds awesome. I tend to have a lot of stations and bases, being able to walk around in structural parts would really make my day.

We are starting work on a gravity plugin for stations, and the first and to be honest, only station I'm doing from TV/movies is The Odyssey from 2001. That will be the test model for the gravity, basically when you can walk around the hub inside, I'll be happy and we can apply that to other parts.

It would be interesting if you could make the gravity proportional to how fast it is spinning, but for just the hub piece of course.

It would be interesting if you could make the gravity proportional to how fast it is spinning, but for just the hub piece of course.

Its going to be tricky, ideally it will be spinning yeah. I have already tried it but its way out of wack, and also exploding kerbals is a constant fear.... bouncing off alot of colliders that are intersecting

but we'll get there. I've always said I want magnetic boots, so after a year going to attempt something along those lines, it just wont be boots as such.
Have you had any issues with the Kerbals falling though the parts when you go away to do another mission and come back?

Part count is related to the actual meshes also. For example, I make a Cockpit. The cockpit is made up of 100 parts in the model. Now, It's still a cockpit, and its still looks like 1 piece to most people, but usually that is made up of many pieces, many objects and unless you actually join parts of your mesh to cut down in the 'internal' part count, it will still have the same laggy result. So if I made the dropship one piece, and had all the animations in one right click menu,

you would find its actually worse, as all the parts would still be combined into +one model, and loading the single piece dropship would feel very laggy.

Welll Part tools .20 came out so i guess im gonna be really busy this weekend!

Well that's pretty clear. Thanks for setting me straight on that. I thought it was a part count thing, but that makes more sense.

Well that's pretty clear. Thanks for setting me straight on that. I thought it was a part count thing, but that makes more sense.

No problemo...

Here.. have a teaser

I have been working on these for most of the day, wanted to make them look like engines... but wheels at the same time... I think they turned out ok.

Meet..

The Hover Wheel!

Those look brilliant! Rovers that double as skycranes, that is gonna help out building bases n stuff.

And I think ya nailed the look, they do indeed look like wheels with engines in them.

Woa devo, im lost for words, so many new things you made and they all look splendid! You put so much detail into your parts (Y) That gravity project sounds like what we and many have been wanting D=D Im sure it will be of the rocks, cheers
